page.title: 02BISLEY VILLAGE
page.content: Bisley is a very attractive village of about 500 residents. It has an entry in the original Domesday Book. Most of the houses are built of Cotswold stone,the oldest being over 400 years old. It is at the highest point in the area being over 800 feet above sea level. It is notorious locally for its cold weather and quantities of snow in winter. It is famous for its fresh water springs which feature annually in the Dressing of the Wells ceremony, with flowers. It has three churches a primary school, two pubs, a general shop and post office, a part-time doctor's surgery, a hairdressers, a restaurant and two antique shops, a market garden, two "manor" houses and a playing-field. There is a local newsheet, The Bisley News, which is published six times a year. It given free to all residents.
